message: I like the interface but I think I still don't get why people would use this kind of apps regularly. What's the difference from a regular forum?
Has a pretty sweet mobile app.

Fast, easy and powerful. They need to add a few more features like photo / video uploading from the browser and iPhone app but convore is on its way to something really great. I really like the group name being the URL. For example my convore page is http://convore.com/craig so this makes it easy for me to share this group. Even a topic has a URL so I can share a topic if I wish e.g. https://convore.com/feedback/how-is-this-different-from-a-regular-internet-forum/

All this makes convore more than just a chat room or forum. The key to convore's success IMO is uptake. If this takes off with private and business users convore could be huge!

1) this could potentially be most or all of the internet forums you need grouped nicely under a single web page, allowing you to follow them all with just one browser tab or surf from one forum (group) to another effortlessly. 2) Posting in a convore group requires a lot less effort. 3) Convore is much better suited for real-time conversation. (duh?)
you are right. I guess I didn't see that at first. Thanks!
The mentioning with @ is nice too
